page.title: 16PARISH OF TIBBERMORE (9)
page.content: At various points within our area, we discovered a disused railway track. The lines had been lifted, but where they had been was clearly observed. On enquiring, we discovered that this was the original Perth-Crieff-Balquhidder Railway. This line opened in two stages, Crieff to Methven Junction, which was built in 1864-65 and Lochearnhead-St. Fillans-Comrie, built in 1897. This line formed what was known as a "Link-line" for the Dunblane-Doune and Callander Railway. The main function of this line was for the transport of agricultural produce from the area and to bring in fertilizer, lime etc., for the many farms. One interesting feature of this old line was that a steam bus used to run between Methven and Perth. This was discontinued in 1937.
